titles.title: Recognizing the sacrifices being made by the families of members of the Armed Forces and supporting the designation of a week as National Military Families Week.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Mr. Jones (NC) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 159.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
6/9/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Recognizes the sacrifices of military families and the support they provide for their loved ones serving as members of the Armed Forces.
Supports the designation of a week as National Military Families Week.
